verses.kjv: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
verses.web: “Be careful that you don’t do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them, or else you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
verses.ct: "Be careful not to do your good deeds in front of others just so they'll notice you. If you do, you won't receive any reward from your Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.web: Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don’t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.ct: So when you give to the needy, don't announce it with trumpets the way hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets, hoping people will praise them. I tell you the truth: they've already gotten the only reward they'll ever receive.

verses.kjv: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
verses.web: But when you do merciful deeds, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand does,
verses.ct: Instead, when you give to the needy, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.

verses.kjv: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
verses.web: so that your merciful deeds may be in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.ct: Give your gifts in secret, and your Father who sees what's done in secret will reward you openly.

verses.kjv: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.web: “When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.ct: When you pray, don't be like the hypocrites. They love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on street corners where everyone can see them. I tell you the truth: they've already gotten the only reward they'll ever receive.

verses.kjv: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
verses.web: But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.ct: But when you pray, go into your room and shut the door. Pray to your Father in that private place, and your Father who sees what's done in secret will reward you openly.

verses.kjv: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
verses.web: In praying, don’t use vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.
verses.ct: When you pray, don't babble on and on with empty words the way the pagans do. They think God will hear them because of their many words.

verses.kjv: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
verses.web: Therefore don’t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.
verses.ct: Don't be like them. Your Father already knows what you need before you even ask him.

verses.kjv: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
verses.web: Pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.
verses.ct: So pray like this: 'Our Father in heaven, may your name be honored as holy.

verses.kjv: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.web: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.ct: May your kingdom come. May your will be done on earth just as it is in heaven.

verses.kjv: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.web: Give us today our daily bread.
verses.ct: Give us today the food we need for the day.

verses.kjv: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
verses.web: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.
verses.ct: Forgive us our debts, just as we have forgiven those who owe us.

verses.kjv: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
verses.web: Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.’
verses.ct: Don't lead us into temptation, but rescue us from the evil one. For yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.'

verses.kjv: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
verses.web: “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.ct: "If you forgive others when they wrong you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

verses.kjv: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.web: But if you don’t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.ct: But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father won't forgive your wrongs either.

verses.kjv: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.web: “Moreover when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.ct: "When you fast, don't put on a gloomy face like the hypocrites do. They make themselves look miserable so everyone will know they're fasting. I tell you the truth: they've already gotten the only reward they'll ever receive.

verses.kjv: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
verses.web: But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face;
verses.ct: But when you fast, wash your face and fix your hair as you normally would,

verses.kjv: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.web: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
verses.ct: so that no one will know you're fasting — only your Father, who sees what's done in secret. And your Father, who sees what's done in secret, will reward you.

verses.kjv: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
verses.web: “Don’t lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;
verses.ct: "Don't store up treasures for yourselves here on earth, where moths and rust destroy them and thieves break in and steal them.

verses.kjv: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
verses.web: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal;
verses.ct: Instead, store up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where moths and rust can't destroy them and thieves can't break in and steal them.

verses.kjv: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.web: for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.ct: Because wherever your treasure is, that's where your heart will be too.

verses.kjv: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
verses.web: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.ct: "Your eye is the lamp of your body. If your eye is healthy, your whole body is filled with light.

verses.kjv: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.web: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
verses.ct: But if your eye is bad, your whole body is filled with darkness. And if the light inside you is actually darkness, how deep that darkness must be!

verses.kjv: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.web: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.
verses.ct: "No one can serve 2 masters. You'll end up hating one and loving the other, or being devoted to one and despising the other. You cannot serve both God and money.

verses.kjv: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
verses.web: Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?
verses.ct: "That's why I'm telling you: stop worrying about your life — what you'll eat or what you'll drink — or about your body — what you'll wear. Isn't life about more than food? Isn't the body about more than clothing?

verses.kjv: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.web: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?
verses.ct: Look at the birds in the sky. They don't plant seeds, they don't harvest crops, and they don't store food in barns — yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you worth far more than they are?

verses.kjv: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.web: “Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?
verses.ct: Can any of you add a single cubit to your life by worrying about it?

verses.kjv: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
verses.web: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin,
verses.ct: And why worry about clothing? Look at how the lilies of the field grow. They don't work or spin thread,

verses.kjv: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.web: yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
verses.ct: yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed as beautifully as one of these flowers.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.web: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?
verses.ct: If God dresses the wild grass so beautifully — grass that's here today and thrown into a fire tomorrow — won't he take much better care of you? How little faith you have!

verses.kjv: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
verses.web: “Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’
verses.ct: "So stop worrying and saying, 'What are we going to eat?' or 'What are we going to drink?' or 'What are we going to wear?'

verses.kjv: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
verses.web: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
verses.ct: Those are the things that people who don't know God chase after. Your heavenly Father already knows you need all of these things.

verses.kjv: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.web: But seek first God’s Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.
verses.ct: Instead, make the kingdom of God and his righteousness your first priority, and all these things will be provided for you as well.

verses.kjv: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
verses.web: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.
verses.ct: So don't worry about tomorrow. Tomorrow will have its own problems. Each day has enough trouble of its own."
